rows.story_text: Let me tell you about the palm tree.

story_text.eng: Let me tell you about the palm tree.

annotation_1.eng: Do you have palm trees where you live? There are many kinds of palm trees -- perhaps yours look different than these.

annotation_2.eng: His necklace has a repeating pattern of yellow and red beads. Count the beads by using the pattern to count by 2's.

annotation_3.eng: He has loops for his ears. How many looping pieces of clothing does he have? Be sure to look all over.

rows.annotation_1: Do you have palm trees where you live? There are many kinds of palm trees -- perhaps yours look different than these.
rows.annotation_2: His necklace has a repeating pattern of yellow and red beads. Count the beads by using the pattern to count by 2's.
rows.annotation_3: He has loops for his ears. How many looping pieces of clothing does he have? Be sure to look all over.

rows.story_text: This tree lives when everything else is dry.

story_text.eng: This tree lives when everything else is dry.

annotation_1.eng: Water is needed by most living things. Palm trees are smart about using very little water in a dry place.

annotation_2.eng: The branches split into two branches as they go up. Count the branches at the top of what we can see before the leaves.

annotation_3.eng: Count the bones and stones on the ground.

rows.annotation_1: Water is needed by most living things. Palm trees are smart about using very little water in a dry place.
rows.annotation_2: The branches split into two branches as they go up. Count the branches at the top of what we can see before the leaves.
rows.annotation_3: Count the bones and stones on the ground.

rows.story_text: The shade from a palm tree is always cool.

story_text.eng: The shade from a palm tree is always cool.

annotation_1.eng: Is there something special about the shade of a palm tree that makes it cool?

annotation_2.eng: Is the shade of all trees cool?

annotation_3.eng: This person barely fits inside this shade. Why did he pick such a small tree? Maybe there aren't any other trees nearby?

rows.annotation_1: Is there something special about the shade of a palm tree that makes it cool?
rows.annotation_2: Is the shade of all trees cool?
rows.annotation_3: This person barely fits inside this shade. Why did he pick such a small tree? Maybe there aren't any other trees nearby?

rows.story_text: We eat fruit from the palm tree.

story_text.eng: We eat fruit from the palm tree.

annotation_1.eng: Name and count the kinds of fruit you like to eat.

annotation_2.eng: Their hair is braided into rows. Which one has more rows that you can see? What is the difference between the two numbers -- how many more?

annotation_3.eng: Does it make sense that the bigger person would have the bigger number of hair rows?

rows.annotation_1: Name and count the kinds of fruit you like to eat.
rows.annotation_2: Their hair is braided into rows. Which one has more rows that you can see? What is the difference between the two numbers -- how many more?
rows.annotation_3: Does it make sense that the bigger person would have the bigger number of hair rows?

rows.story_text: We use palm leaves to thatch our houses.

story_text.eng: We use palm leaves to thatch our houses.

annotation_1.eng: This house has a round shape. Round houses are easier to build and enclose more space.

annotation_2.eng: Do you have any round buildings where you live?

annotation_3.eng: Balls and light bulbs are usually round. What are some round things around you?

rows.annotation_1: This house has a round shape. Round houses are easier to build and enclose more space.
rows.annotation_2: Do you have any round buildings where you live?
rows.annotation_3: Balls and light bulbs are usually round. What are some round things around you?

rows.story_text: We make brooms and mats from palm leaves.

story_text.eng: We make brooms and mats from palm leaves.

annotation_1.eng: Of the things around you, which of them look like they are made directly from trees or other natural materials?

annotation_2.eng: Count together the number of different things in this picture that are made from a palm.

annotation_3.eng: Count the number of loops that she is wearing. Is the number more or less than the man had on an earlier page?

rows.annotation_1: Of the things around you, which of them look like they are made directly from trees or other natural materials?
rows.annotation_2: Count together the number of different things in this picture that are made from a palm.
rows.annotation_3: Count the number of loops that she is wearing. Is the number more or less than the man had on an earlier page?

rows.story_text: We use palm tree seeds for fuel.

story_text.eng: We use palm tree seeds for fuel.

annotation_1.eng: Burning palm tree seeds is one of many possible sources of heat. How do you get heat where you live?

annotation_2.eng: What are other uses for heat besides cooking?

annotation_3.eng: An estimate is an educated guess based on partial information. Estimate the number of seeds in that basket. Is it a bigger number than you know?

rows.annotation_1: Burning palm tree seeds is one of many possible sources of heat. How do you get heat where you live?
rows.annotation_2: What are other uses for heat besides cooking?
rows.annotation_3: An estimate is an educated guess based on partial information. Estimate the number of seeds in that basket. Is it a bigger number than you know?

rows.story_text: Do you see why the palm tree is important?

story_text.eng: Do you see why the palm tree is important?

annotation_1.eng: List and count how many ways the palm tree is useful to them.

annotation_2.eng: What are some trees where you live that have important uses?

annotation_3.eng: Whether useful or not, what are some of your favorite trees near you?

rows.annotation_2: What are some trees where you live that have important uses?
